resources.string: Easy tool to measure you reaction time.
The only thing you have to do after you press \'Play!\' is waiting for the screen to turn red. When so, press the screen to record your reaction time.
This process must be done 5 times to ensure a good measure and calculate a correct average.
When the result is shown, you can retry or upload it to the cloud.

If you choose to upload it, you have to write a name for Leaderboard purposes (you can change it when you want, but it can not be 2 identically names). Also, you have to allow us the access to your phone Email to correctly store your Score*.
*The only data we will store is your public Email, if you want to delete it from our database, just email us and we will delete it.
Latency on you phone will be affecting your results, this means that if you have a slow phone, you will have a worse score than others who have a better phone.
Even the fastest phone has latency, so take that on mind. Some can add 30–50ms, others only 20–25 meanwhile the oldest can add up to 100ms.
The average reaction time for humans may vary between 200–300, so feel free to subtract some \'ms\' to your final result for personal information.
Taps lower than 100ms will be not counted as this is impossible for humans to achieve.
Tap when the colour turns GREEN
You must tap when the colour is GREEN, not when its RED
